intro: Heliophila chamomillifolia, commonly known as the meadow heliotrope, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, often hairy foliage. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink, typically blooming in late summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and along stream banks. Heliophila chamomillifolia is known for its pleasant fragrance and is sometimes used in herbal remedies.
